content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 255.721 - Distribution systems: patrolling

State Regulations
(a) The frequency of patrolling mains must be determined by the severity of the
conditions which could cause failure or leakage, and the consequent hazards to
public safety. (b) Mains in places
or on structures where anticipated physical movement or external loading could
cause failure or leakage must be patrolled at intervals not exceeding 41/2
months, but at least four times each calendar year. (c) Distribution lines operating at 125 psig
(862 kPa) or more in Class 3 and 4 locations must comply with the transmission
patrolling requirements in section
255.705
of this Part. Notes
